description: Number of parts if 3^n is partitioned into parts of size 2^n as far as possible and into parts of size 1^n.
comments: Corresponds to the only solution of the Diophantine equation 3^n = x*2^n + y*1^n with constraint 0 <= y < 2^n.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,500
formula: a(n) = A002379(n) + A002380(n) = floor(3^n/2^n) + (3^n mod 2^n).For n>2, a(n) = 3^n mod (2^n-1). [From _Alex Ratushnyak_, Jul 22 2012]
prog: (PARI) {for(n=1,33,d=divrem(3^n,2^n); print1(d[1]+d[2],","))}(PARI) { for (n=1, 500, write("b060692.txt", n, " ", floor(3^n/2^n) + (3^n%2^n)); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 09 2009](Haskell)a060692 n = uncurry (+) $ divMod (3 ^ n) (2 ^ n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 11 2014
